title: Anima Mundi

properties.name: description
properties.value: Anima Mundi is the life force of Gielinor.[1] It has a strong connection to spirit trees and other flora of the world, and is most alluded to by gnomes.[2][3][4] Anima is fed by life.[5]

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Anima
"Anima" redirects here. For the seeds, see Anima seed.

Anima Mundi is the life force of Gielinor.[1] It has a strong connection to spirit trees and other flora of the world, and is most alluded to by gnomes.[2][3][4] Anima is fed by life.[5]

The Tasakaal took on the purpose of serving the balance between life and death to protect the anima of Gielinor. According to them, without life there is no anima, but because life can also destroy and endanger the anima, it must be kept under control.[5][6]

When Argento was killed, Hazelmere felt a sudden pain, believing it to be the Anima Mundi crying out for the death of the spirit tree.[2]

According to a gnome child, the Anima Mundi works in mysterious ways.[7] He also states that when a cabbage is plucked from the soil, its connection to the Anima Mundi is irreversibly severed.[4]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Felfiz Yaryus, Old School RuneScape. "[...] the Anima Mundi, the life force of our world."
  2. ^ 2.0 2.1 Hazelmere, "The Eyes of Glouphrie", Old School RuneScape. "[...] I felt a sudden pain, as if the Anima Mundi was crying out with the loss of a favoured child.... And I knew that one of the Old Ones had died, and I had lost a friend."
  3. ^ Felfiz Yaryus, Old School RuneScape. "Here, you can grow Iasor, Kronos and Attas plants. [...] Three unique plants with a special affinity to the Anima Mundi, the life force of our world."
  4. ^ 4.0 4.1 Gnome Child, "20th Anniversary event", Old School RuneScape. "I wish to witness the moment when the individual cabbage's connection to the Anima Mundi is irreversibly severed, as you pluck it from the nurturing soil in the field south of Falador."
  5. ^ 5.0 5.1 Kaal-Xil-Dar, Old School RuneScape. "The anima of this world, it is fed by life."
  6. ^ Tasakaal, Old School RuneScape.
    • Kaal-Mej-San: Without life, there is no anima.
    • Kaal-Ket-Jor: But life can also destroy. It can endanger the anima.
    • Kaal-Xil-Dar: So life must be kept in check.
    • Kaal-Mej-San: This is our purpose.
  7. ^ Gnome Child, "20th Anniversary event", Old School RuneScape. "Some forces in this world move in mysterious ways. Gravity, the Anima Mundi and the price of granite mauls are just three everyday examples."
